p: Terpenoids and phenylpropanoid derivatives are the main constituents of EOs [ 3]. The most common terpenoids found in EOs are the monoterpenes and the sesquiterpenes. There is increasing interest in the pharmacological actions of the constituents found in EOs, especially terpenes [ 3]. Here, we summarize the pharmacological properties of the constituents isolated from EOs and the mechanisms underlying their actions. Table 2 is a summary of pharmacological properties of EO constituents from different plants and the underlying mechanisms of their effects.
